intro: Tylostylis discolor, commonly known as the red-stemmed grass, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems that often turn reddish in color. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grasses. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tylostylis discolor is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
